jdbc.query

Class ParkQueries

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdbc.query.ParkQueries

  • public class ParkQueries
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles database operations related to parks within the system. This class provides methods for retrieving and updating park information, including fetching park details by ID, updating park parameters based on approved requests, and managing the fullness status of parks on specific dates. It operates by executing SQL queries against a MySQL database, utilizing the MySqlConnection class to establish connections. Methods in this class include operations such as: - Retrieving park details by park ID or park name. - Updating park parameters like maximum capacity, estimated stay time, and the number of reserved spots based on requests. - Inserting and updating records in the parkfulldates table to track when parks are fully booked. This class is essential for maintaining accurate and up-to-date information about parks, which is critical for both administrative and operational functionalities of the system. Tamer Amer, Gal Bitton, Rabea Lahham, Bahaldeen Swied, Ron Sisso, Nadav Reubens.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ParkQueries

        public ParkQueries()

    • Method Detail

      • getParkById

        public boolean getParkById(Park park)
        Retrieves the details of a park based on its ID and updates the provided Park object with these details. This method searches for a park in the database using its unique ID. If found, it updates the Park object with information such as park name, maximum capacity, estimated stay time, estimated reserved spots, current number of visitors in the park, and the price.
        Parameters:
        park - The Park object to be updated with the retrieved details. This object must have its parkId set.
        Returns:
        true if the park details were successfully retrieved and the Park object was updated; false if the park could not be found or if an SQL exception occurred.

      • getParkByName

        public ServerResponse getParkByName(Park park)
        Retrieves park details by park name from the database.
        Parameters:
        park - The Park object containing the name of the park for which details are being fetched.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponse indicating the outcome of the operation. Possible responses include Fetched_Park_Details_Successfully if the park details are retrieved successfully, Fetched_Park_Details_Failed if the park does not exist, and Query_Failed if an SQL exception occurs.

      • getParksNames

        public ServerResponse getParksNames(java.util.ArrayList<ParkNameEnum> parkList)
        Retrieves a list of park names from the database.
        Parameters:
        parkList - An ArrayList of ParkNameEnum to be populated with the names of the parks.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponse indicating the outcome of the operation. Possible responses include Park_List_Names_Is_Created if the park names are successfully retrieved and populated into parkList, Park_Table_Is_Empty if no parks exist in the database, and Query_Failed if an SQL exception occurs.

      • returnParkPrice

        public ServerResponse returnParkPrice(Park park)
        Fetches the current price for a given park.
        Parameters:
        park - The Park object containing the name of the park for which the price is being queried.
        Returns:
        A ServerResponse indicating the outcome of the operation. Possible responses include Park_Price_Returned_Successfully if the park price is successfully retrieved, Fetched_Park_Details_Failed if the park does not exist, and Query_Failed if an SQL exception occurs.

      • InsertNewValueInRequestedPark

        public ServerResponse InsertNewValueInRequestedPark(Request request)
        Updates a specific field of a park in the database based on a request. The field to be updated is determined by the type of the request, and the new value is applied as specified in the request. This method is typically used to process approved requests that modify park parameters such as maximum capacity, estimated stay time, or the number of reserved spots.
        Parameters:
        request - The Request object containing details about the update, including the park ID, the new value, and the type of request which determines the field to be updated.
        Returns:
        ServerResponse.Updated_Requests_Successfully if the update was successful, ServerResponse.Fetched_Park_Details_Failed if the update failed due to the park not being found, or ServerResponse.Query_Failed if an SQL exception occurred during the operation.

      • returnCapacityCurrentInParkForPark

        public int[] returnCapacityCurrentInParkForPark(int parkId)
        Retrieves the current capacity and the number of visitors currently in the park.
        Parameters:
        parkId - The ID of the park.
        Returns:
        An array containing two integers: the first is the maximum capacity of the park, and the second is the current number of visitors in the park. Returns null if an error occurs.

      • updateParkFullDateTable

        public boolean updateParkFullDateTable(QueryType operation,
                                       java.time.LocalDate date,
                                       java.lang.String parkName)
        Updates the park full dates table based on the operation specified. It can insert a new full date or update an existing one.
        Parameters:
        operation - The type of operation to perform (Insert or Update).
        date - The date to be updated or inserted as full.
        parkName - The name of the park.
        Returns:
        true if the operation is successful, false if an error occurs.
